dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4627 IH: To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to modify treatment activities for assistance to combat HIV/AIDS.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Ansari (for herself, Mr. Carson, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Evans of Pennsylvania, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Hernández, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Mrs. McIver, Ms. Norton, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Pressley, Ms. Simon, Mr. Soto, Mr. Thanedar, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Wasserman Schultz, and Mrs. Watson Coleman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to modify treatment activities for assistance to combat HIV/AIDS.

section.header: Modification of prevention activities for assistance to combat HIV/AIDS
section.text: Section 104A(d) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151b–2(d)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance before including;
in subparagraph (J), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (K), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
assistance to provide HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) medications.
subparagraph (D), by adding and at the end; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period; and
by inserting after specific populations the following: (including at-risk populations in accordance with scientific-based analysis as designated by the World Health Organization);

by striking efforts to reduce the risk of HIV/AIDS infection including and inserting efforts to reduce the risk of HIV/AIDS infection which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance, including pre- and; and
by adding at the end before the period the following: , which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance.
